intro: Dichosciadium ranunculaceum, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North America, particularly found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. The plant features delicate, trifoliate leaves and produces showy, blue to purple flowers with a distinctive yellow center. It is characterized by its small, rounded capsules that contain numerous tiny seeds. Dichosciadium ranunculaceum is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
